statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Charlie Brown Jr. and Lamarr Kimble, both returning after injuries kept them sidelined a year ago, scored 21 and 19 points, respectively, as Saint Joseph's cruised past Monmouth in the campus opener of the Myrtle Beach Invitation on Monday night.
article.headline: Returners lead Saint Joseph's past Monmouth, 78-63
article.linkText: Returners lead Saint Joseph's past Monmouth, 78-63
article.story: PHILADELPHIA -- Charlie Brown Jr. and Lamarr Kimble, both returning after injuries kept them sidelined a year ago, scored 21 and 19 points, respectively, as Saint Joseph's cruised past Monmouth in the campus opener of the Myrtle Beach Invitation on Monday night. For Brown, it was his second straight game with 20 or more points, and Kimble reached double digits for the second straight game. Pierfrancesco Oliva was in double digits for rebounds (10) for the second straight game and dished five assists. Monmouth shot the ball well, hitting 26 of 54 shots from the field (48.1 percent), including 4 of 18 from beyond the arc. But Saint Joseph's got Monmouth on sheer volume -- putting up 68 shots from the field and knocking down 28 (41.2 percent) and hitting 7 of 29 from distance. Saint Joseph's also dominated on the boards, outrebounding Monmouth 43-29 with 15 offensive rebounds. Ray Salnave scored 14 points to lead Monmouth, with Deion Hammond and Mustapha Traore each adding 12. Saint Joseph's travels to South Carolina Tuesday for a tournament game Thursday against Wake Forest.
